label: axiom-bounded-algorithmic-diameter
name: Bounded Algorithmic Diameter
statement:
- The algorithmic space $(\mathcal{Y}, d_{\mathcal{Y}})$ is Polish (complete, separable metric space).
- Its diameter is finite: $D_{\mathcal{Y}} := \operatorname{diam}_{d_{\mathcal{Y}}}(\mathcal{Y}) < \infty$.

These conditions ensure Wasserstein metrics $W_p$ on probability measures over $(\mathcal{Y}, d_{\mathcal{Y}})$ are well‑posed and that all per‑walker squared displacements are bounded by $D_{\mathcal{Y}}^2$.
core_assumption_text: - The algorithmic space $(\mathcal{Y}, d_{\mathcal{Y}})$ is Polish (complete, separable metric space).
